topic.title: Database as a Service: 2.0 Release Notes

section.title: No option to reset password on Vertica Preview instance on Horizon
section.p: Vertica clusters can be accessed via credentials obtained by enabling root, either through Horizon or the Trove CLI. Single node Vertica instances must have root enabled through the Trove CLI, as this action is not available in Horizon.

section.title: Searching for log entries returns API KEY ERROR: Missing
section.p: The current Vertica Management Console release has a known issue where attempting to search for Vertica log entries may result in an API key being requested. As a workaround, it is suggested to access Vertica event data directly through the database's ACTIVE_EVENTS, QUERY_EVENTS and QUERY_REQUESTS tables, as described in Managing a Vertica Preview Cluster from the Management Console.

section.title: "Stack trove in status ROLLBACK_COMPLETE" message when DBaaS installation fails
section.p: The installation process may display a ROLLBACK_COMPLETE message when installation fails. This may look like the following:
section.codeblock: .devplatform)stack@redwood:~$ openstack --os-cloud mycloud hdpi database install --path dbaas-qcow2_2.0.0.31.csu dbaas-qcow2_2.0.0.31.csu is already downloaded dbaas-qcow2_2.0.0.31.csu is already (installed) Disabling SSL Features for databaseervice Launching stack... Stack trove creating Stack trove in status ROLLBACK_COMPLETE UI installed for database Create service endpoint for service database Completed installing database (.devplatform)stack@redwood:~$

section.title: “mysql cluster 5.5” listed as option in Launch Instance dialog
section.p: When Launch Instance is selected in the Project->Database->Instances panel in Horizon, a Datastore option of mysql-cluster version 5.5 is displayed. Selecting this option creates a standard mysql cluster.
